definitions.definition: to leave a place, thing, or person, usually for ever
examples: We had to abandon the car.
By the time the rebel troops arrived, the village had already been abandoned.

definitions.definition: to leave behind or run away from someone or something, or to give up something
examples: Air attacks forced the villagers to abandon their homes.
The government has abandoned its plans to increase taxes.

definitions.definition: to stop doing an activity before you have finished it
examples: The game was abandoned at half-time because of the poor weather conditions.
They had to abandon their attempt to climb the mountain.

definitions.definition: to become less strong or decrease
examples: The storm has started to abate.
The pain in his shoulder showed no sign of abating.

definitions.definition: to reduce the amount, degree, or intensity of something
examples: The government is trying to abate inflation.
The company is taking steps to abate pollution.
